s.text: Giri peer-reviewed the piece for the NYROB and recommended publication.
Puppeteering 101 : As an exercise in spin analysis, Culturebox puts this question to you, dear reader: Who looks more like a buffoon in the wake of James Fallows's leaving U.S.

The source has to be so powerful, and the signal has to find some coupling path to the fuel sensors, and that's not easy because there are many obstacles in between."

The real mystery, though, is why the story was emblazoned last April on the cover of that newsletter for high-minded literary Brahmins, The New York Review of Books --and why, last week, in the same publication's pages, the head of the National Transportation Safety Board stepped forth to debate the author.
The answer says everything about what Evans has become.
If you asked people about a lot of accidents, if you said: Could this happen?
